newsitem.title: USA: USDA to buy 2,217,600 lbs frozen pork for schools.
newsitem.headline: USDA to buy 2,217,600 lbs frozen pork for schools.

text.p: The Agricultural Marketing Service of the U.S. Department of Agriculture said it plans to buy 2,217,600 lbs of frozen coarse ground pork for use in the National School Lunch Program.
All offers must be in the format prescribed in LS-50 and be received by 1500 EDT in Washington, D.C., on Friday, August 30, 1996. Acceptances will be announced by midnight Friday, September 6, 1996.
Shipments must be made in the delivery periods October 7 through October 18 and October 21 through November 1, 1996.
